title: Americans abroad weekend roundup: Four U.S. women’s soccer players score
text:
Many players competing in lesser leagues or with reserve/youth squads are not listed. Americans with dual nationalities representing other national teams have also been omitted.

*Named to U.S. national team for friendlies vs. Mexico last Friday and Uruguay on Tuesday

**Named to U.S. under-23 squad for friendly vs. Japan on Monday

***Named to U.S. under-20s for friendlies vs. Zagreb last Thursday and UAE’s U-23s on Monday

****Named to U.S. under-17s for friendlies vs. Mexico last Thursday, Netherlands on Saturday, Denmark on Monday

ENGLAND

Premier League

Chelsea midfielder Christian Pulisic* (age 20): FIFA break (played 90 in 3-0 U.S. defeat to Mexico, rejoined Chelsea)

Newcastle United defender DeAndre Yedlin: FIFA break (injured)

Everton U-23 goalkeeper Nico Defreitas-Hansen (age 18): FIFA break

Newcastle U-23 midfielder Kyle Scott: FIFA break

Aston Villa U-23 midfielder Indiana Vassilev*** (age 18): FIFA break

Tottenham Hotspur U-23 goalkeeper Brandon Austin (age 20): FIFA break

Liverpool midfielder Matteo Ritaccio*** (age 17): U-18s

Leicester City goalkeeper Chituru Odunze**** (age 16): U-18s (did not play in U.S. under-17’s 2-1 victory over Mexico, played 90 in 3-1 victory over Netherlands)

Norwich City defender Jonathan Tomkinson**** (age 17): U-18s (did not play in U.S. under-17’s 2-1 victory over Mexico, played 90 in 3-1 victory over Netherlands)

Women’s Super League

West Ham forward Martha Thomas: played 90 (scored in 58th) in 2-1 defeat at Arsenal

Wonderful header by Martha Thomas.



Erin Simon crosses from the right and Thomas leaps brilliantly to send a downward header past Arsenal keeper Manuela Zinsberger and into the corner.



Arsenal 2-1 West Ham pic.twitter.com/DWYIglKiab — Women's Football News (@WFRumour) September 8, 2019

West Ham defender Erin Simon: played 72 (assist)

Birmingham City midfielder Bri Visalli: played 74 in 1-0 defeat to Everton

Birmingham City defender Adrienne Jordan: played 90

Championship

Fulham defender Tim Ream*: FIFA break (did not play vs. Mexico)

Fulham U-23 midfielder Luca de la Torre: FIFA break

Fulham U-23 defender Marlon Fossey: FIFA break

Reading defender Matt Miazga, on loan from Chelsea: FIFA break

Nottingham Forest midfielder Gboly Ariyibi: FIFA break

Sunderland midfielder Lynden Gooch: vs. Burton Albion, ppd.

description: With most men's leagues off for international matches, the women took the stage.
authors: Steven Goff Has Covered Soccer For The Washington Post Since The Early His Beats Include D.C. United
The U.S. National Teams. He Has Been On Assignment At Every World Cup Since
